laboratory_examinations.findings: Osteolytic lesion in the right 1st rib and a fracture in the right 2nd rib.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At the 15-month follow-up, a newly developed osteolytic lesion in the right scapula, suggesting a pathological fracture, was observed.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Triglyceride level in the pleural effusion was 335 mg/dL.
FDG uptake in the right 1st and 2nd ribs increased (maximal standardized uptake value = 4.0).
Suspicious leakage and web-like lymphatic channels around the right lower neck and subclavian vein.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Intranodal lymphangiogram showed no abnormalities except for prominent lymphatic channels in the right upper hemithorax.
